info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 17 at 4:00PM CDT until May 17 at 6:00PM CDT by NWS San Angelo TX
info.description:
* WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of west central Texas, including the following county, San Saba.
* WHEN...Until 600 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 357 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms from 10 miles southwest of Richland Springs to San Saba to 5 miles northeast of San Saba. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... San Saba, Richland Springs, Algerita, Sloan, Skeeterville, Hall, Harkeyville, Spring Creek, Locker and Us-190 Near The Mcculloch-San Saba County Line. - This includes the following Low Water Crossings... FM 1030 crossing Wallace Creek, CR 340 crossing Dry Creek, CR 208 crossing San Saba River, CR 340 crossing San Saba River, crossings along County Road 246, crossings along County Road 244 and crossings along County Road 238. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CDT THIS EVENING
